title: doc: FAQ overstates the size of a Go "hello, world" binary
body:
"hello, world" is substantially smaller for me than detailed in the [FAQ](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/faf611a07a7630a075fba3a555db7831e002122a/doc/go_faq.html#L1769-L1771), presumably as a result of the compiler improvements in Go 1.7.

Specifically, [`hello.go`](https://golang.org/doc/code.html#Command) from How To Write Go Code compiles to only 1.6 MB on my Linux install, and so this is a more favourable comparison for Go than is currently stated.

### What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
1.7.1
